basics.name: Devin Yuncheng Hua
basics.label: Researcher, AI Scientist
basics.summary: Dr. Devin Yuncheng Hua is a Postdoctoral Fellow at UNSW with dual PhDs in AI and Computer Science, whose research in NLP, LLMs, and related fields has led to 20+ publications in top venues and active service in major academic committees.

location.address: Computer Science Building (K17), Engineering Rd, UNSW Sydney, Kensington NSW 2033

work.name: School of Computer Science and Engineering (CSE), UNSW Sydney
work.summary: Working on the GenAISim project, developing generative and data-driven simulations to support urban decision-making by integrating stakeholder knowledge, socio-technical insights, and large language models.

work.name: Department of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence (DSAI), Monash University
work.summary: Contributing to the DARPA-initiated CCU project, advancing NLP and LLM technologies to model and adapt to diverse socio-cultural norms across languages and communities, resulting in five publications at top-tier AI conferences.

work.name: Intelligent Customer Service Center, Voice Interaction Department, Meituan Group, China
work.summary: As an Algorithmic Strategy Engineer at Meituan, I led the development of an LLM-powered intelligent customer service chatbot that autonomously resolved after-sales issues and user complaints by understanding user intent, managing emotions, and executing backend actions—ultimately serving tens of thousands of users daily and contributing to two top-tier AI publications.

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Generative AI Simulation (GenAISim)
projects.summary: The GenAISim project is funded by the ARC Centre of Excellence for Automated Decision Making and Society (ADM+S), Australia. This project will investigate a hybrid decision- making system, leveraging cooperative knowledge from multiple stakeholders through socio-technical observations, and knowledge priors in Large Language Models (LLMs) and open datasets. It will develop a novel suite of generative and data-driven simulations, useful for depicting current and future urban scenarios, including in mobility, urban policymaking, and health domains.
